easy.q: I ride on four legs in the morning and two at noon. What am I?
easy.a: A person (the human develops from crawling as a baby to walking on two legs)

medium.q: I am a word of letters three; add two, and fewer there will be. What word am I?
medium.hint: Play with the idea of adding letters to change meaning.

hard.q: A box has four corners but contains no sides. Inside, a hidden rule makes two opposite pairs equal. What is the rule that keeps the pairs balanced?
hard.a: Opposite sides of a kite are equal and the diagonals bisect each other
hard.hint: Think about shapes where lines cross and halves match.
